subject: Communication
title: Conflict Prevention: Agreements Before Arguments
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Conflict Prevention: Agreements Before Arguments.

hook.text: The best firefighters don't fight fires. They prevent them. The same principle applies to conflict.

buildup.text: Many conflicts are predictable: unclear roles, mismatched expectations, and ambiguous boundaries cause most disputes.

discovery.text: Proactive agreements â€” 'Here's how we'll handle disagreements when they arise' â€” prevent escalation before it starts.

twist.text: Creating conflict protocols during peacetime is easy. Trying to create them mid-argument is nearly impossible.

climax.text: The best teams, marriages, and organizations have pre-agreed processes for navigating conflict before it occurs.

punchline.text: The best conflict resolution happens before the conflict does.

quiz.question: When is the best time to create conflict resolution protocols?
